alert.note: Alert for Greenville; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 2:08PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River Near above Old Easley Rd, 5 W Greenville affecting Greenville and Pickens Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Saluda River near above Old Easley Rd, 5 W Greenville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 and 9.0 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. Common, nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to the Saluda River is beginning. Floodwaters are beginning to impact farmland, woodlands, nurseries, parks, athletic fields, golf courses, greenways, and boat-access areas with up to 2 feet of inundation. Floodwaters are likely beginning to impact the lowest elevation of residential yards along Shop Ct, Covenant Dr, Riverview Dr, and Riverview Cir. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 3.9 feet Monday morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EST.
